definition: a fish at the bottom of the pot (idiom)/in a desperate situation
kettle/cauldron
(equivalent to 的 as possessive particle)
background/bottom/base/end (of the month, year etc)/remnants/(math.) radix/base
to swim/variant of 遊|游[you2]
to walk/to tour/to roam/to travel
surname You

fish/CL:條|条[tiao2],尾[wei3]

sentences.english: Surrounded heavily by our troops, the enemy were like a fish in the pot.
sentences.chinese: 敌军被我军重重包围，已成为釜底游鱼。

definition: lit. like a turtle in a jar/to be trapped (idiom)
a cornered beast will still fight (idiom)/to fight like an animal at bay
lit. when the nest overturns no egg remains intact/no member escapes unscathed from a family disaster (idiom)
lit. the path exhausted, the end of the road (idiom); an impasse/in a plight with no way out/things have reached a dead end
lit. a bird startled by the mere twang of a bow (idiom)/fig. sb who frightens easily, due to past experiences
precarious as pile of eggs (idiom); ready to fall and break at any moment/in a dangerous state
to beat a tiger from the front door, only to have a wolf come in at the back (idiom); fig. facing one problem after another

definition: lit. almanac from years back (idiom)/obsolete practice/old-fashioned principle

the wolf runs and the wild boar rushes (idiom); crowds of evil-doers mill around like wild beasts
troops in defeat like a landslide (idiom); a beaten army in total collapse
insignificant wretch
leaving the door open invites the thief (idiom); to invite disaster by giving evildoers a free hand
lit. the whole nest came out (to fight us)/a turnout in full force (of a gang of villains)
starving people everywhere (idiom); a state of famine
dried bones in burial mound (idiom); dead and buried
